title: IP SAN compared to hostname string (binary mismatch + OOB read)
problem: `memcmp` compares raw SAN IP bytes against the ASCII hostname string for `gn->value.dataLen` bytes. This never matches valid IP SANs and can read past the hostname buffer (e.g., IPv6 "::" is 2 bytes but SAN length is 16), causing out-of-bounds reads and false verification failures.

title: Hostname/IP verification uses AND semantics
problem: If both hostnames and IP are configured, the function requires the hostname match to succeed before it even checks the IP. This makes verification fail even when the IP matches, which is surprising for an API that allows multiple hosts/IPs.

title: Host flag value read incorrectly on big-endian targets
problem: `CERT_STORE_CTRL_SET_HOST_FLAG` passes an `int64_t*` with a 4-byte length. On big-endian systems, `X509_SetHostFlags` will read the high 32 bits (zero for valid values), so hostflags are effectively ignored.

title: Hostname verification ignores configured host flags
problem: DNS hostname checks always pass `0` as flags, so the newly added `hostflags` setting is never applied to DNS matches (only to IP checks). This makes the host flag API ineffective for DNS validation.

title: Missing error handling for hostnames copy failure
problem: `BSL_LIST_Copy` can return NULL on allocation failure, but the code ignores it and returns success, silently dropping hostnames and masking the error.
